subject: Learning
title: The 10% Brain Myth
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The 10% Brain Myth.

hook.text: You've heard it a hundred times: 'We only use 10% of our brain.' It's completely false.

buildup.text: The myth likely started from a misquote of William James or early brain-damage research.

discovery.text: Brain scans show every region is active at some point. Even during sleep, far more than 10% fires.

twist.text: If 90% were unused, brain damage would rarely matter. But even small lesions cause major deficits.

climax.text: We use 100% of our brainâ€”just not all at once, and not all equally for every task.

punchline.text: You already use your whole brain. The trick is using it better.

quiz.question: What do brain scans reveal about the 10% myth?
options: Every region of the brain is active at some point
Only 10% of regions ever show activity
50% of the brain is permanently dormant
